alert.note: Alert for Central Siskiyou County (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 25 at 8:46PM PST until February 28 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO 4 PM PST SUNDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM MONDAY TO 4 AM PST TUESDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM MONDAY TO 4 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 55 mph. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, mainly north of Yreka. For the Winter Storm Warning, mainly from Gazelle and Weed southward on I-5, but also near Hilt and Highway 3 and 96 toward Fort Jones and Klamath River. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, Yreka south to Gazelle, including Montague. * WHEN...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 AM to 4 PM PST Sunday. For the Winter Storm Warning, from 4 AM Monday to 4 AM PST Tuesday. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from 4 AM Monday to 4 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions through Sunday. Travel could be very difficult to impossible on Monday. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. Significant blowing and drifting snow could result in whiteout conditions south of Weed on Monday. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is likely and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
